page.description: If the List definition specified that client-side summary values should be computed for any of the fields in the list, retrieves the summary value.

argument.name: UXListName
argument.description: The ID of the List control.

argument.name: field
argument.description: The field to fetch the summary.

argument.name: summaryType
argument.description: The type of summary to get. Can be one of the following values:

discussion.p: The *[ui:{dialog.object}.getListClientSideSummaryValues()]* method will fetch the summary value for a field. *[The list must be configured to compute summary values]* to use this method. You can configure the List to compute summary values using the [Compute summary values] client-side property.

description.p: To get a summary value, you must specify both the field and the summary value you want to get from the specified List. For example, the example below will get the *[js:'total']* for the *[js:'QTY']* columin in *[js:'list1']*:

section.example: //get the 'total' for the 'QTY' column in 'list1' var valueTot = {dialog.object}.getListClientSideSummaryValue('list1','QTY','total');
section.important: The summary value will only be available if you specifically requested it in the List builder.
